subject: RS 470
author: Debbie Tejada
full_text:
Thanks all for the info on the 470. I did call the RS 800 number and  
the person I spoke with could not guarantee that the radio pictured on  
their web site would be the one that ships (it's a photo of the old  
model). Confusing -- he said that he's in Louisville and the warehouse  
is in Kentucky and so he couldn't physically check himself or contact  
someone in the warehouse. The last time I looked at a map, I could  
have sworn Louisville was in Kentucky.

If anyone comes across the old 470 in your travels, please keep me in  
mind. I'll continue to look myself.

Any suggestions for another good hack? I did hear the clicking on the  
469(?) and it is too much.
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

Deb T

"Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing  
that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy. "  ~Albert  
Einstein

On Jan 2, 2008, at 10:46 AM, bruce halliday wrote:

> Deb,
>
> The old model of the 470 is now like hens teeth I doubt very much if  
> you will be able to find one
> If I come across one I will let you know.
>
> You may want to ask at your local radio shack if they would call  
> other stores and see if any of them have any in stock
> I did that and wound up with 8 that promptly got snatched up by new  
> researchers.
>
> If you can not get the older 470 maybe you can find the old model  
> 469 which looks exactly like the old 470 but the difference
> between the old and new model 469 is that the older model does not  
> have that annoying clicking. It scans smoothly.
>
> I am attaching a pic of the old model 470 make sure you tell the  
> person at RS you want the one in the box not the see through
> package.
>
> If you want to check out my box site it's http://free-paranormalinvestigating.com/franksboxjoesbox/
>
> Bruce
>
>
>
> Bruce Halliday
>
>
>
>
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> From: debbie@...
> Date: Wed, 2 Jan 2008 10:12:08 -0700
> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: New files in my Radio Shack Box Folder
>
> Steve (or anyone else who knows about this),
>
> The
> new 470 is all black and can't be modified as of yet
>
> Based on your comments about the 12-469, I'm going to pick up a  
> 12-470 later today. I called our local Radio Shack and the guy  
> insisted that the new 12-470 is exactly the same as the old one,  
> just the case is a different color (grey & black). I specifically  
> asked if the electronics were set up the same way and he said yes,  
> they're exactly the same. Do you suppose he's right about that? Or  
> just doesn't know the product that well?
> _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _
>
> Debbie Tejada
>
>
> 'Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing  
> that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy. '  ~Albert  
> Einstein
>
> On Jan 1, 2008, at 8:44 PM, Steve Hultay wrote:
>
> There is no pulsing on the older style 12-470, just clear
> communication. My 12-469 is sitting in the corner and i'll probably
> never touch it again because that constant pulse noise is very
> distracting to get past to hear any audible messages. That's just my
> personal opinion anyway for what it's worth. If you listen to my
> radio shack files from today you will hear the difference between the
> two boxes. The sweep between the two are both linear, but one has
> the pulse sound and one is just a clean sweep without the pulse. Ask
> your local radio shack if they have any 12-470 older style models,
> they are gray with a white top and also has a built in speaker. The
> new 470 is all black and can't be modified as of yet but i think Mike
> C. could figure it out if he didn't have 500 other projects going at
> the same time....lol Any questions just shoot me an e-mail and i
> will help the best i can.
>
> -Steve H.
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, 'babiarz3' <babiarz3@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> > Steve, hope your holidays were wonderful. We haven't had the chance
> to
> > speak in a few weeks.
> > What are the difference in the 469 and the 470 besides 2 channel vs.
> > 4? You are still choosing one channel and it is still a linear sweep
> > right? Technically, what would be the difference in choosing AM on
> the
> > 469 and AM on the 470? The pulsing sound is absolutely annoying.
> >
> > Babs
> >
> >
> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, 'Steve Hultay' <urkel23@> wrote:
> > >
> > >
> > > Had a pretty good session today, i've been pretty blocked with
> other
> > > boxes yet i seem to always get great results with the RS 12-470.
> Some
> > > really good responses to my questions. Hey babs, i think you
> should
> > > give the RS box a little time and maybe you will start to get
> stuff.
> > > Although i have a 12-469 also and it really sux compared to the
> 12-
> > > 470. The constant pulsing noise in the 469 model just drives me
> crazy
> > > enough to not concentrate. Try looking for an older style model
> of the
> > > 12-470, that's probably the best radio i own hands down. Instant
> > > results always and consistently. All my boxes work, but they are
> > > finicky sometimes. No need to comment to my posted files guys,
> just
> > > listen and see if i'm on some sort of a right track with the
> > > communication.
> > >
> > > -Steve H.
> > >
> >
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Don't get caught with egg on your face. Play Chicktionary! Check it  
> out!
>
>  <RS_12-470.jpg>
